Package rubank

Class Date

java.lang.Object
pizzapizza.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Date>
public class Date extends Object implements Comparable<Date>
The Date class is made for the Date object, holding pertinent information related to a Date such as the year, month, and day while also having getters and setters for those instance variables, helper methods like isLeapYear(), and overridden methods like equals(), and compareTo().
Author:
Sibi suriyanarayan Tiruchirapalli venketaramani, Rahulraj Rajesh

    • isLeapYear

      private static boolean isLeapYear(int year)
      Checks if a given year is a leap year, according to leap year rules. Leap years are determined based on the following rules: - A year is a leap year if it is divisible by 4. - However, if the year is also divisible by 100, it is not a leap year, unless: - The year is also divisible by 400, in which case it is a leap year.
      Parameters:
      year - The year to check for leap year status.
      Returns:
      true if the given year is a leap year, false otherwise.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Checks if the date is a valid calendar date (i.e. a past date).
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid, false otherwise.

    • dayMonthYearValid

      private boolean dayMonthYearValid()
      Checks if the day, month, and year combination represents a valid calendar date.
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid, false otherwise.

    • oldEnough

      private boolean oldEnough()
      Checks if the given date is valid (i.e. if the date is greater than 16 years).
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid, false otherwise.

    • under24

      public boolean under24()
      Checks if the given date is valid (i.e. if the date is less than 24 years).
      Returns:
      true if the date is valid, false otherwise.

    • validity

      public String validity()
      Checks the validity of the date of birth (DOB) based on different criteria.
      Returns:
      An error message if the DOB is invalid, an empty string otherwise.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(Date o)
      Compares this date to another date for ordering based on year, month, and day. This method compares the current date to another date (o) and returns a negative integer if this date is less than the specified date (o), zero if they are equal, and a positive integer if this date is greater than the specified date (o).
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      o - The Date to compare with this Date.
      Returns:
      A negative integer if this Date is earlier than the specified Date o, zero if they are the same date, and a positive integer if this Date is later than the specified Date o.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the date in the format "month/day/year".
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representation of the date.

    • testDaysInFeb_NonLeap

      private static void testDaysInFeb_NonLeap()
      Test case method to check the validity of February 29th in a non-leap year. Creates a Date object representing February 29, 2011, and checks whether it's a valid date. Since 2011 is not a leap year, February should only have 28 days, making this date invalid.

    • testDaysInFeb_Leap

      private static void testDaysInFeb_Leap()
      Test case method to check the validity of February 29th in a leap year. Creates a Date object representing February 29, 2024, which is a leap year, and checks whether it's a valid date. 2024 is a leap year, meaning February has 29 days, making this date valid.

    • testMonth_outOfRange

      private static void testMonth_outOfRange()
      Test case to check if the month is out of the valid range (1-12) for a given date. Creates a Date object with a month value of 0 (which is out of the valid range). Calls the 'isValid' method to check if the date is valid, expected output is 'false' Checks if the expected output and the actual output match The test result is displayed in the console.

    • testDay_outOfRange

      private static void testDay_outOfRange()
      Test case to check if the day is out of the valid range for a given date. Creates a Date object with a day value of 31 for April, which has only 30 days. Calls the 'isValid' method to check if the date is valid, expected output is 'false' Checks if the expected output and the actual output match The test result is displayed in the console.

    • testTrueSixMonthsCheck

      private static void testTrueSixMonthsCheck()
      Test case to check if a date is within 6 months of today's date and is considered valid. Creates a Date object for January 20, 2024, and checks if it is within 6 months of the current date. Expected output is 'true' since the date is within the valid range, Checks if the expected output and the actual output match The test result is displayed in the console.

    • testFalseSixMonthsCheck

      private static void testFalseSixMonthsCheck()
      Another test case to check if a date is within 6 months of today's date and is considered valid. Creates a Date object for June 1, 2024, and checks if it is within 6 months of the current date. Expected output is 'false' since the date is within the valid range, Checks if the expected output and the actual output match The test result is displayed in the console.

    • testPastDate

      private static void testPastDate()
      Test case to check if a date is in the past and is considered invalid. Creates a Date object for January 20, 2023, and checks if it is in the past (earlier than current date). Expected output is 'false' since the date is in the past, Checks if the expected output and the actual output match The test result is displayed in the console.

    • testResult

      private static void testResult(Date date, boolean expectedOutput, boolean actualOutput)
      This method prints out whether the test case has been passed or if it fails
      Parameters:
      date - The date that is being checked
      expectedOutput - The correct value that should be printed
      actualOutput - The value that the Java logic arrives at

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Checks all the aforementioned private method testcases
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments.
